subject.name: Human Resource Development and Organizational Behavior
subject.description: This course explores the principles of Human Resource Management and Organizational Behavior. It covers HR functions, planning, recruitment, performance management, industrial relations, and the behavioral aspects of organizations including leadership, motivation, and conflict management.
objectives: To understand the role and significance of Human Resource Management in modern organizations.
To learn the processes of HR planning, recruitment, and selection.
To explore performance management systems and industrial relations frameworks.
To study organizational behavior concepts such as personality, attitudes, leadership, and conflict management.

units.title: Introduction to HRM and HR Planning
topics: Human Resources Planning: Planning Process and Levels

units.title: Recruitment, Selection, and Training
topics: Training and Development: Need for skill upgradation
Techniques of employee and executive training

units.title: Performance Management and Industrial Relations
topics: Performance Management System: Definition, Concepts, and Ethics
Industrial Relations: Factors influencing industrial relations

units.title: Organizational Behavior and Personality
topics: Definition, Importance, and Historical Background of OB
Fundamental Concepts, Challenges, and Opportunities for OB

units.title: Leadership, Politics, and Conflict Management
topics: Leadership: Definition, Importance, and Theories of Leadership Styles
Organizational Politics: Definition and Factors influencing Political Behavior
Conflict Management: Traditional and Modern Views of Conflict
